DOC.HEAD: Close Lower
Eds: New throughout
DOC.TEXT: Stocks ended lower in drab trading Tuesday as dealers reacted to a weak tone on Wall Street in the absence of any inspiring news out of London. The Financial Times-Stock Exchange 100-share index ended down 16.4 points, or 0.7 percent, closing at 2,342.1. The Financial Times 30-share index finished 12.0 points lower at 1,852.5. The Financial Times 500-share index fell 7.78 points to close at 1,273.16. Volume totaled 589.2 million shares, up from 524.4 million shares Monday.
